definition: upside down/upturned
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: The thieves had turned the house upside down looking for the papers.
sentences.chinese: 那些小偷们为了找寻那些文件而把屋子翻了个底朝天。

sentences.english: I told the detective that it was the refrigerator that blew up my condo.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉侦探，是我的冰箱把我的公寓炸了个底朝天。

sentences.english: Tossed to and fro by the waves, the little craft finally turned turtle.
sentences.chinese: 小船被浪打得遥来晃去，最后翻了个底朝天。

sentences.english: And I'm like, knock discomfort upside the head and move it over and get all A's.
sentences.chinese: 我就是要把这不适翻个底朝天每科都拿到A。

sentences.english: The intruders turned the Russian war veteran's home upside down in the Kirovsky region.
sentences.chinese: 这群盗贼将这位退伍军人的家翻了个底朝天。

sentences.english: The car skidded on the ice and turned turtle.
sentences.chinese: 小汽车在冰面上滑倒，翻了个底朝天。

definition: same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
Chaotian district of Guangyuan city 廣元市|广元市[Guang3 yuan2 shi4], Sichuan

to rummage through/to turn everything over/to ransack
four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back
to take even the cooking pots (idiom)/to clean out/to wipe out
tumble/somersault
corner/nook
(idiom) everything broken and in disorder
to search everywhere/to search high and low/to comb
to overturn/to turn upside down
